snippet: The carmaker’s chief executive said he expected the upward sales trend to continue, bolstering both Chrysler and its parent, Fiat.
abstract: Chrysler's unlikely revival is accelerating, leaving General Motors and Ford scrambling to catch up; Chrysler outperformed industry in 2012 with 20.6 percent increase in domestic sales in market that grew by 13.4 percent; new versions of its Jeep Grand Cherokee and Compass SUV's are fueling sales.
lead_paragraph: The carmaker’s chief executive said he expected the upward sales trend to continue, bolstering both Chrysler and its parent, Fiat.

headline.seo: Chrysler Pauses to Mark an Unlikely Comeback
headline.main: In Unlikely Comeback, Chrysler Is Outgaining Bigger Detroit Rivals
headline.print_headline: In Unlikely Comeback, Chrysler Is Outgaining Bigger Detroit Rivals
